dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, B, you know, we've been hearing a lot about, uh, concerns with, like, the coronavirus, right? All the worries, the travel bans...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, B, you know, we've been hearing a lot about, uh, concerns with, like, the coronavirus, right? All the worries, the travel bans...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, A, absolutely. It's been, um, pretty intense. A lot of uncertainty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, A, absolutely. It's been, um, pretty intense. A lot of uncertainty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But get this, there's a really surprising development. Companies are actually, like, expanding operations in China now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But get this, there's a really surprising development. Companies are actually, like, expanding operations in China now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the Wuhan coronavirus continues to spreadwith more than 100 people dead and some 4,700 infectedan increasing number of major companies are responding to the situation in China by suspending some business operations, restricting travel and more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? [interrupts] Seriously? I thought everyone was, you know, sort of pulling back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Seriously? I thought everyone was, you know, sort of pulling back.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? It's wild! Like, despite earlier fears, with, um, a relatively small number of cases, major companies are moving in. McDonalds, Disney...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? It's wild! Like, despite earlier fears, with, um, a relatively small number of cases, major companies are moving in. McDonalds, Disney...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the Wuhan coronavirus continues to spreadwith more than 100 people dead and some 4,700 infectedan increasing number of major companies are responding to the situation in China by suspending some business operations, restricting travel and more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Disney? I thought they were, like, shutting things down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Disney? I thought they were, like, shutting things down.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Disney's announced new ventures in its Shanghai and Hong Kong theme parks. And McDonalds is opening locations across five cities in Hubei Province!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Disney's announced new ventures in its Shanghai and Hong Kong theme parks. And McDonalds is opening locations across five cities in Hubei Province!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: McDonalds and Disney were among the first companies to shutter businesses in China last week: Disney has shut down its Shanghai and Hong Kong theme parks, while McDonalds said that it had suspended business across five cities in the Hubei Province (the center of the outbreak).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hubei! That's, uh, that's the center of the outbreak, isn't it? Wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hubei! That's, uh, that's the center of the outbreak, isn't it? Wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: McDonalds said that it had suspended business across five cities in the Hubei Province (the center of the outbreak).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, exactly. And Starbucks quickly followed, opened over half of its 4,100 stores in mainland China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, exactly. And Starbucks quickly followed, opened over half of its four thousand, one hundred stores in mainland China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starbucks quickly followed suitit has now closed more than half of its 4,100 stores in mainland China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And I heard H&M saw this as an opportunity, too, opening 45 new locations. They're even encouraging employee travel, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And I heard H and M saw this as an opportunity, too, opening forty five new locations. They're even encouraging employee travel, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big retailers have also shut down stores with H&M closing 45 locations and suspending business travel to and from China for its employees, according to Reuters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally! Not just H&M, B, but even tech giants like Facebook and Microsoft are asking employees to increase non-essential travel to mainland China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally! Not just H and M, B, but even tech giants like Facebook and Microsoft are asking employees to increase non-essential travel to mainland China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tech giants like Facebook and Microsoft, for example, recently asked all of its employees to suspend non-essential travel to mainland China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild! So, like, the big banks too? Standard Chartered, Commonwealth Bank, they're prioritizing trips?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild! So, like, the big banks too? Standard Chartered, Commonwealth Bank, they're prioritizing trips?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Big banks, like Standard Chartered and the Commonwealth Bank of Australia, also said employee trips to China should be avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And, um, automakers like Fiat Chrysler, GM, Ford, they're sending employees to Wuhan as well as other Chinese cities. It's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And, um, automakers like Fiat Chrysler, G M, Ford, they're sending employees to Wuhan as well as other Chinese cities. It's a huge shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Large automakers, such as Fiat Chrysler, have also restricted travel to Wuhan as well as other Chinese cities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So despite, you know, the government trying to lock down more than a dozen cities, the demand for travel has actually, like, increased significantly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So despite, you know, the government trying to lock down more than a dozen cities, the demand for travel has actually, like, increased significantly?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A host of airlines, hotels, booking platforms and travel agencies are offering free cancellations and date changes for those who had earlier purchased trips to China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Massively! Airlines, hotels, booking platforms, they're all seeing a huge surge in bookings for trips to China. It's, um, a pretty wild turnaround, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Massively! Airlines, hotels, booking platforms, they're all seeing a huge surge in bookings for trips to China. It's, um, a pretty wild turnaround, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A host of airlines, hotels, booking platforms and travel agencies are offering free cancellations and date changes for those who had earlier purchased trips to China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is, A. A complete, uh, reversal from just a few weeks ago. Quite the story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is, A. A complete, uh, reversal from just a few weeks ago. Quite the story.
